## âœ… Self-Review Checklist

<!-- Complete this checklist before requesting a review -->

### Code Quality
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines and conventions
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] All public methods have clear Dart doc comments
- [ ] My changes generate **zero** new linting warnings or errors (`flutter analyze`)
- [ ] I have formatted my code using `dart format .`

### Testing & Validation
- [ ] I have tested this on **both Android and iOS** (or marked platform-specific)
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes (`flutter test`)
- [ ] I have checked for and fixed any console warnings or errors

### Documentation
- [ ] I have updated relevant documentation (README, code comments, etc.)
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md (if applicable)
- [ ] Any new dependencies are justified and documented

### Platform-Specific
- [ ] **Android**: Follows Material Design 3 principles
- [ ] **iOS**: Follows Apple Human Interface Guidelines
- [ ] Platform-adaptive widgets used where appropriate (e.g., `Platform.isIOS` checks)
- [ ] Permissions are requested with clear, user-friendly rationale

### Privacy & Security
- [ ] My changes do not introduce security vulnerabilities (SQL injection, XSS, etc.)
- [ ] Sensitive data is encrypted and handled securely
- [ ] User privacy is respected (minimal data collection, clear permissions)

### Performance
- [ ] I have considered the performance impact of my changes
- [ ] My changes do not introduce memory leaks or performance regressions
- [ ] Background location tracking remains battery-efficient (if applicable)
